dt: {bc}permission, liberty, or ability to enter, approach, or pass to and from a place or to approach or communicate with a person or thing

dt.t: Investigators wanted to get {wi}access{/wi} to his home.
consultants who have easy {wi}access{/wi} to the president

dt: {bc}freedom or ability to obtain or make use of something
{bc}a way or means of entering or approaching

dt.t: A canal provides {wi}access{/wi} to the river.
a building that provides wheelchair {wi}access{/wi} {gloss}=a way for people in wheelchairs to enter{/gloss}

dt: {bc}the act or an instance of {d_link|accessing|access:2} something

dt.t: If it had been in Tito's nature to feel an {wi}access{/wi} of rage, he would have felt it against this bull-faced accomplice.

et: Middle English, "entrance, approach, attack of illness, fever, lovesickness," borrowed from Anglo-French & Medieval Latin; Anglo-French {it}acces{/it} "attack of illness," (Old French also "liberty to approach"), borrowed from Latin {it}accessus{/it} "approach, means of entry, right of approach, onset (of fever or illness)," action noun derived from {it}accēdere{/it} "to approach" {ma}{mat|accede|}{/ma}
shortdef: permission, liberty, or ability to enter, approach, or pass to and from a place or to approach or communicate with a person or thing
freedom or ability to obtain or make use of something
a way or means of entering or approaching

dt: {bc}to get at {bc}to gain access to: such as
{bc}to be able to use, enter, or get near (something)

dt.t: a system that makes it easier to {wi}access{/wi} the money in your bank account

dt: {bc}to open or load (a computer file, an Internet site, etc.)

dt.t: a file that can be {wi}accessed{/wi} by many users at the same time

shortdef: to get at : to gain access to: such as
to be able to use, enter, or get near (something)
to open or load (a computer file, an Internet site, etc.)

dt.t: … a separate, controversial proposal to redefine broadband {wi}access providers{/wi} as telecommunications services.

dt: {bc}the lag between the time stored information is requested (as from a computer) and the time it is delivered

dt.t: Although other types of nonvolatile memory are increasingly available … such storage options typically cost more per bit and hold less data than disks do or have slow {wi}access time{/wi}.

shortdef: the lag between the time stored information is requested (as from a computer) and the time it is delivered

dt: {bc}having access restricted to a relatively small number of points

shortdef: having access restricted to a relatively small number of points

dt: {bc}permitting access to stored data in any order the user desires

shortdef: permitting access to stored data in any order the user desires

dt: {bc}{d_link|access|access:1} to a computer or a computer system from another location by means of a network connection

dt.t: If the person went along with the call, the scammer would try to convince them to provide {wi}remote access{/wi} to their computer.

shortdef: access to a computer or a computer system from another location by means of a network connection

dt.t: Investigators are trying to {it}gain/get access to{/it} his financial records.

shortdef: to get the right to see

dt.t: He was {it}granted/denied access to{/it} the report.
